intro: Malleostemon microphyllus, commonly known as the small-leaved malleostemon, is a flowering plant native to the south-western United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of tiny, white to yellowish flowers. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Malleostemon microphyllus is often found in rocky areas and is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
